content: 1 sierra s lacy tunic about this is a modified version of erin kate archer s cancun lace boxy top i have changed the original pattern so that it is knit in one piece starting at the underarms going up and over the shoulders connecting front and back at the underarms then knit in the round to the desired length there is no seaming required it can be knit as cropped blouse or tunic length in a variety of yarn weights and/or fibers such as cotton or linen for a summer top or wool as a winter vest directions are given to adapt to your yarn your gauge and your size lacy stitch panels can be knit in any order desired with 4 row of garter separating each panel once you are knitting the body in the round you can check the length by trying on your garment you just put the stitches on a waste yarn and try it on you can keep knitting or stop whenever you want 2 supplies  dk yarn suggested yarn weight depending on width length and yarn selection 500-1 000 yards  size 6 circular needles or size needed to meet your desired gauge 2 sets one 24 and one 32  crochet hook appropriate for yarn weight  scrap yarn  1 row marker  row counter optional gauge - 4 5 stitches per inch or st/in needed to produce desired fabric depending on your yarn choice finished size recommended width should be your hip size length will be your desired length to begin find a top of similar design in your closet that you love the way it fits you will be comparing your knit top to this top take your measurements head size - ______________ this will be your neck opening size hips - __________________ this will be your width compare these measurements with the top from your closet and make any adjustments you feel necessary for your knit top to fit the way you love while you are at it measure from the shoulder to the underarm of your top this will be your arm opening measurement arm opening - __________________ this should be somewhere between 7-11 swatch co 24 stitches using the needle size recommended for your yarn knit 1 ½ in garter if you are happy with the feel of the fabric continue if you feel it is too loose or too tight then try again with a different needle size a size larger if your swatch is too tight a size smaller if it is too loose once you are happy with the feel of the fabric continue on knitting a sample of each of the flat lace stitches a-c ending with 4 knit row garter 3 your swatch should look like this once your swatch is done determine your stitches per inch by measuring in the garter row _____________ record your stitches per inch here now do the math 1 take your hip measurement _________
